com.revolsys.parallel.channel.store

Class ZeroBuffer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revolsys.parallel.channel.ChannelValueStore<T>
      • com.revolsys.parallel.channel.store.ZeroBuffer<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class ZeroBuffer<T>
extends ChannelValueStore<T>

    Description

    The ZeroBuffer class is an implementation of ChannelValueStore which allows one Object to be sent across the Channel at any one time.

    The getState method will return EMPTY if the Channel does not contain an Object and FULL if it does.

    Author:
    P.D.Austin

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        protected Object clone()
        Returns a new Object with the same creation parameters as this Object. This method should be overridden by subclasses to return a new Object that is the same type as this Object. The new instance should be created by constructing a new instance with the same parameters as the original. NOTE: Only the sizes of the data should be cloned not the stored data.
        Specified by:
        clone in class ChannelValueStore<T>
        Returns:
        The cloned instance of this Object.

      • get

        protected T get()
        Returns the Object from the ZeroBuffer.

        NOTE: getState should be called before this method to check that the state is not EMPTY. If the state is EMPTY the ZeroBuffer will be left in an undefined state.

        Pre-condition: The state must not be EMPTY

        Specified by:
        get in class ChannelValueStore<T>
        Returns:
        The next available Object from the ChannelValueStore

      • getState

        protected int getState()
        Returns the current state of the ZeroBuffer, should be called to ensure the Pre-conditions of the other methods are not broken.
        Specified by:
        getState in class ChannelValueStore<T>
        Returns:
        The current state of the ZeroBuffer (EMPTY or FULL)

      • put

        protected void put(T value)
        Puts a new Object into the ZeroBuffer.

        NOTE: getState should be called before this method to check that the state is not FULL. If the state is FULL the ZeroBuffer will be left in an undefined state.

        Pre-condition: The state must not be FULL

        Specified by:
        put in class ChannelValueStore<T>
        Parameters:
        value - The object to put in the ChannelValueStore

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
